Identification.LongTitle: Benzodiazepines and Other Targeted Substances Regulations

Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Health, pursuant to subsection 55(1) of the Controlled Drugs and Substances Acta, hereby makes the annexed Benzodiazepines and Other Targeted Substances Regulations (1091).

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: Act means the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act. (Loi)
adult means an individual of 18 years of age or older. (adulte)

advertisement, in respect of a targeted substance, includes any representation by any means for the purpose of promoting, directly or indirectly, the sale or other disposal of the targeted substance. (publicité)

common-law partner in relation to an individual, means a person who is cohabiting with the individual in a conjugal relationship, having so cohabited for a period of at least one year. (conjoint de fait)

competent authority means a public authority of a foreign country that is authorized under the laws of the country to approve the importation or exportation of targeted substances into or from the country. (autorité compétente)
designated criminal offence means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an offence involving the financing of terrorism against any of sections 83.02 to 83.04 of the Criminal Code;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an offence involving fraud against any of sections 380 to 382 of the Criminal Code;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the offence of laundering proceeds of crime against section 462.31 of the Criminal Code;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an offence involving a criminal organization against any of sections 467.11 to 467.13 of the Criminal Code; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a conspiracy or an attempt to commit, being an accessory after the fact in relation to, or any counselling in relation to, an offence referred to in any of paragraphs (a) to (d). (infraction désignée en matière criminelle)

Definition.Text: destroy, in respect of a targeted substance, means to alter or denature it to such an extent that its consumption is rendered impossible or improbable. (destruction)

emergency medical service vehicle means any conveyance authorized under the laws of a province to transport individuals to hospitals and on which emergency medical services are provided. (véhicule de service médical d’urgence)
hospital means a facility that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is licensed, approved or designated as a hospital by a province under the laws of the province to provide health care or treatment to persons or animals; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is owned or operated by the government of Canada or of a province and that provides health services. (hôpital)

Definition.Text: international obligation means an obligation relative to a targeted substance set out in a convention, treaty or other multilateral or bilateral instrument that Canada has ratified or to which Canada adheres. (obligation internationale)
licensed dealer means the holder of a licence issued under section 17.1. (distributeur autorisé)
midwife has the same meaning as in section 1 of the New Classes of Practitioners Regulations. (sage-femme)
nurse practitioner has the same meaning as in section 1 of the New Classes of Practitioners Regulations. (infirmier praticien)
pharmacist means a person who is entitled under the laws of a province to practise pharmacy and is practising pharmacy in that province. (pharmacien)
podiatrist has the same meaning as in section 1 of the New Classes of Practitioners Regulations. (podiatre)
prescription means an authorization given by a practitioner that a stated amount of a targeted substance be dispensed for the person named in it or the animal identified in it. (ordonnance)
qualified person in charge means the individual designated under subsection 15(1). (responsable qualifié)

Security Directive means the Directive on Physical Security Requirements for Controlled Substances and Drugs Containing Cannabis, as amended from time to time and published by the Government of Canada on its website. (Directive en matière de sécurité)
senior person in charge means the individual designated under section 14. (responsable principal)
specified name means, in respect of a controlled substance included in Schedule 1,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name specified in column 1 of an item of Schedule 2, but, if only the chemical name is specified, means the chemical name specified in column 2 of that item; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the controlled substance is not specified in Schedule 2, its chemical name and, if available, its common name. (nom spécifié)

Definition.Text: targeted substance means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a controlled substance set out in Schedule 1; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a midwife, nurse practitioner or podiatrist, a controlled substance set out in Schedule 1 that the midwife, nurse practitioner or podiatrist may prescribe, possess or conduct an activity with, in accordance with section 3 of the New Classes of Practitioners Regulations. (substance ciblée)

Definition.Text: test kit means a kit

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that contains a targeted substance and a reagent system or buffering agent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that is used during the course of a chemical or analytical procedure to test for the presence or quantity of a targeted substance for a medical, laboratory, industrial, educational, law administration or enforcement, or research purpose; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the contents of which are not intended or likely to be consumed by, or administered to, a person or an animal. (nécessaire d’essai)

Section.Text: A member of a police force or a person acting under their direction and control who, in respect of the conduct of the member or person, is exempt from the application of subsection 4(2) or section 5, 6 or 7 of the Act by virtue of the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act (Police Enforcement) Regulations is, in respect of that conduct, exempt from the application of these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: A person is authorized to possess a targeted substance set out in Part 2 of Schedule 1 if the person has obtained the targeted substance in accordance with these Regulations, in the course of activities conducted in connection with the administration or enforcement of an Act or regulation, or from a person who is exempt under section 56 of the Act from the application of subsection 5(1) of the Act with respect to that targeted substance, and the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: requires the targeted substance for their business or profession and is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a licensed dealer,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a pharmacist, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a practitioner who is registered and entitled to practise in the province in which they possess the targeted substance;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is a practitioner who is registered and entitled to practise in a province other than the province in which they possess the targeted substance for emergency medical purposes only;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is a hospital employee or a practitioner in a hospital;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: has obtained the targeted substance for their own use or the use of another person for whom, or an animal for which, they are responsible

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: from a practitioner, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in accordance with a prescription that was not issued or obtained in contravention of these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: is employed as an inspector, a member of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police, a police constable, a peace officer or a member of the technical or scientific staff of the Government of Canada, the government of a province or a university in Canada and their possession is in connection with that employment;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: is exempt under section 56 of the Act with respect to the possession of that targeted substance and their possession is for a purpose set out in the exemption;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: has imported the targeted substance in accordance with section 68 for their own use or the use of another person for whom, or an animal for which, they are responsible;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: is a person who, in accordance with a permit for transit or transhipment, is responsible for the targeted substance while it is in transit or in transhipment in Canada; or

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: is the Minister.

Subsection.Text: A person is authorized to possess a targeted substance set out in Part 2 of Schedule 1 if the person is acting as the agent or mandatary of any person who is authorized to possess it in accordance with any of paragraphs (1)(a) to (d) and (f) to (h).

Subsection.MarginalNote: Agent or mandatary — person referred to in paragraph (1)(e)
Subsection.Text: A person is authorized to possess a targeted substance set out in Part 2 of Schedule 1 if they

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: are acting as the agent or mandatary of a person who they have reasonable grounds to believe is a person referred to in paragraph (1)(e); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: possess the targeted substance for the purpose of assisting that person in the administration or enforcement of an Act or regulation.

Subsection.Text: An individual may possess a targeted substance set out in Part 2 of Schedule 1 for the purpose of exporting that substance in accordance with section 69.

Section.Text: A person may sell, possess or otherwise deal in a test kit if the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a registration number has been issued for the test kit under section 6 or subsection 10(2) and has not been cancelled under subsection 9(1);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the test kit is labelled with

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the registration number, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a test kit that is not subject to the labelling requirements of the Medical Devices Regulations,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the name and address of the manufacturer or assembler or, if the test kit is manufactured or assembled in accordance with a custom order, the name and address of the person for whom the test kit was manufactured or assembled, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the test kit will be used for a medical, laboratory, industrial, educational, law administration or enforcement, or research purpose.

Subsection.Text: The manufacturer or assembler of a test kit or, if the test kit is manufactured or assembled in accordance with a custom order, the person for whom the test kit was manufactured or assembled, may obtain a registration number for the test kit by submitting to the Minister an application containing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name of the test kit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of the design and construction of the test kit;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of the targeted substance and other substances, if any, contained in the test kit, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the specified name of the targeted substance and the name of any other substance,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the substance is a salt, the name of the salt, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of the substance;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the proposed use of the test kit; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the directions for use of the test kit.

Subsection.Text: The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by the person authorized by the applicant for that purpose; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include an attestation by that person that all of the information submitted in support of the application is correct and complete to the best of their knowledge.

Subsection.Text: The applicant must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.

Section.Text: Subject to section 7, on completion of the review of the application for a registration number, the Minister must issue a registration number for the test kit, preceded by the letters “TK”, if the Minister determines that the test kit will only be used for a medical, laboratory, industrial, educational, law administration or enforcement, or research purpose.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to issue a registration number for a test kit if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the test kit poses a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of the targeted substance in the test kit being diverted to an illicit market or use, because

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the total amount of the targeted substance in the test kit is too high, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the adulterating or denaturing agent in the test kit is not likely to prevent or deter the consumption of the targeted substance in the test kit by a person or animal or the administration of that substance to a person or animal; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the test kit is likely to be used for a purpose other than one referred to in section 6.

Subsection.Text: Before refusing to issue a registration number, the Minister must send the applicant a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the applicant an opportunity to be heard.

Section.Text: The symbol required by subparagraph C.01.004(1)(b)(iv) of the Food and Drug Regulations does not need to appear on the label of a test kit if the label displays the registration number that has been issued for the test kit under section 6 or subsection 10(2).

Subsection.Text: The Minister must cancel the registration number of a test kit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister receives a notice from the holder of the registration number stating that they have ceased to conduct all activities with respect to the test kit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the test kit is a medical device and is no longer approved for sale in Canada under the Medical Devices Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: one of the circumstances referred to in subparagraph 7(1)(a)(i) or (ii) exists; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the test kit is being used for a purpose other than a medical, laboratory, industrial, educational, law administration or enforcement, or research purpose and that the test kit poses a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of the targeted substance in the test kit being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: When the registration number of a test kit is cancelled, the number

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: must not be displayed on the label of any test kit manufactured or assembled after the cancellation; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a cancellation under paragraph (1)(a), must remain on the label of any existing test kit until all of the test kits with that registration number are disposed of.

Subsection.Text: The following persons may, after a period of 90 days following the cancellation of the registration number of a test kit, obtain a new registration number by submitting to the Minister an application that is supported by proof that the circumstances that gave rise to the cancellation have been corrected:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer or assembler of the test kit; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the test kit is manufactured or assembled in accordance with a custom order, the person for whom the test kit was manufactured or assembled.

Subsection.Text: On completion of the review of the application, the Minister must issue a new registration number for the test kit unless a condition referred to in any of paragraphs 9(1)(b) to (d) applies.

Section.Text: The holder of a registration number for a test kit must inform the Minister in writing, within 30 days after the occurrence, if they have

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ceased to conduct all activities authorized by section 4 with respect to the test kit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: transferred the manufacturing or assembly of the test kit to another person;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: increased the quantity of targeted substance in the test kit;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: changed the brand name of the test kit;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: altered in any manner the adulterating or denaturing agent in the test kit or changed the quantity of either agent in it; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: substituted the adulterating or denaturing agent with another one.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer may produce, assemble, sell, provide, transport, send, deliver, import or export a targeted substance if they comply with these Regulations and the terms and conditions of their dealer’s licence and any permit issued under these Regulations.
A licensed dealer may conduct an activity in relation to a targeted substance at their site only if the qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge is present at the site.
A licensed dealer must obtain a permit in order to import or export a targeted substance.
A licensed dealer may possess a targeted substance for the purpose of exporting it if they have obtained it in accordance with these Regulations.

Section.Text: The following persons may apply for a dealer’s licence:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who ordinarily resides in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a corporation that has its head office in Canada or operates a branch office in Canada; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of a position that includes responsibility for targeted substances on behalf of the Government of Canada or of a government of a province, a police force, a hospital or a university in Canada.

Section.Text: An applicant for a dealer’s licence must designate only one individual as the senior person in charge, who has overall responsibility for management of the activities with respect to targeted substances that are specified in the licence application. The applicant may designate themself if the applicant is an individual.

Subsection.Text: An applicant for a dealer’s licence must designate only one individual as the qualified person in charge, who is responsible for supervising the activities with respect to targeted substances that are specified in the licence application and for ensuring that those activities comply with these Regulations. The applicant may designate themself if the applicant is an individual.

An applicant for a dealer’s licence may designate an individual as an alternate qualified person in charge, who is authorized to replace the qualified person in charge when that person is absent. The applicant may designate themself if the applicant is an individual.
Only an individual who meets the following requirements may be designated as a qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: they work at the site specified in the dealer’s licence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: they

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: are entitled or, if applicable, registered and entitled by a provincial professional licensing authority or a professional association in Canada and entitled to practise a profession that is relevant to their duties, such as pharmacist, practitioner, pharmacy technician or laboratory technician,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: hold a diploma, certificate or credential awarded by a post-secondary educational institution in Canada in a field or occupation that is relevant to their duties, such as pharmacy, medicine, dentistry, veterinary medicine, pharmacology, chemistry, biology, pharmacy technician, laboratory technician, pharmaceutical regulatory affairs or supply chain management or security, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: hold a diploma, certificate or credential that is awarded by a foreign educational institution in a field or occupation referred to in subparagraph (ii) and hold

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: an equivalency assessment as defined in subsection 73(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: an equivalency assessment issued by an organization or institution that is responsible for issuing equivalency assessments and is recognized by a province;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: they have sufficient knowledge of and experience with the use and handling of the targeted substances specified in the dealer’s licence to properly carry out their duties; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: they have sufficient knowledge of the provisions of the Act and these Regulations that are applicable to the activities specified in the dealer’s licence to properly carry out their duties.

Subsection.Text: An applicant for a dealer’s licence may designate an individual who does not meet any of the requirements of paragraph (3)(b) as a qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: no other individual working at the site meets those requirements;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: those requirements are not necessary for the activities specified in the licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the individual has sufficient knowledge — acquired from a combination of education, training or work experience — to properly carry out their duties.

Section.Text: An individual is not eligible to be a senior person in charge, a qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge if, during the 10 years before the day on which the dealer’s licence application is submitted,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a designated substance offence or a designated criminal offence or a designated offence as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Cannabis Act, the individual

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: was convicted as an adult, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: was a young person who received an adult sentence, as those terms are defined in subsection 2(1) of the Youth Criminal Justice Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of an offence committed outside Canada that, if committed in Canada, would have constituted a designated substance offence or a designated criminal offence or a designated offence as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Cannabis Act,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the individual was convicted as an adult, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if they committed the offence when they were at least 14 years old but less than 18 years old, the individual received a sentence that was longer than the maximum youth sentence, as that term is defined in subsection 2(1) of the Youth Criminal Justice Act, that could have been imposed under that Act for such an offence.

Subsection.Text: A person who intends to conduct an activity referred to in section 12 must obtain a dealer’s licence for each site at which they intend to conduct activities by submitting an application to the Minister that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the licence is requested by

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an individual, the individual’s name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a corporation, its corporate name and any other name registered with a province under which it intends to conduct the activities specified in its dealer’s licence or by which it intends to identify itself, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the holder of a position described in paragraph 13(c), the applicant’s name and the title of the position;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the municipal address, telephone number and, if applicable, the email address of the proposed site and, if different from the municipal address, its mailing address;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name, date of birth, telephone number and email address of the proposed senior person in charge;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to each of the proposed qualified person in charge and any proposed alternate qualified person in charge,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: their name, date of birth, telephone number and email address,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the title of their position at the site,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and title of the position of their immediate supervisor at the site,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, the profession they practise that is relevant to their duties, the name of the province that authorizes them to practise it and their authorization number, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: their education, training and work experience that are relevant to their duties;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the activities that are to be conducted and the targeted substances in respect of which each of the activities is to be conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if the licence is requested to manufacture or assemble a product or compound that contains a targeted substance, other than a test kit, a list that includes, for each product or compound,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name of the product or the name of the compound,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug identification number that is assigned to the product under section C.01.014.2 of the Food and Drug Regulations, if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the specified name of the targeted substance in the product or compound,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the strength per unit of the targeted substance in it, the number of units per package and the number of packages,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is to be manufactured or assembled by or for another licensed dealer under a custom order, the name, municipal address and licence number of the other licensed dealer, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: if the applicant’s name appears on the label of the product or compound, a copy of the inner label, as defined in section A.01.010 of the Food and Drug Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if the licence is requested in order to produce a targeted substance other than a product or compound that contains a targeted substance,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the specified name of the targeted substance,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity that the applicant expects to produce under their licence and the period during which that quantity would be produced, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is to be produced for another licensed dealer under a custom order, the name, municipal address and licence number of the other licensed dealer;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: if the licence is requested for an activity that is not described in paragraph (f) or (g), the specified name of the targeted substance for which the activity is to be conducted and the purpose of the activity;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of the security measures in place at the site, determined in accordance with the Security Directive; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of the method for recording information that the applicant proposes to use for the purpose of section 40.

Subsection.Text: An application for a dealer’s licence must be accompanied by the following documents:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the applicant is a corporation, a copy of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the certificate of incorporation or other constituting instrument, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any document filed with the province in which its site is located that states its corporate name and any other name registered with the province under which the applicant intends to conduct the activities specified in its dealer’s licence or by which it intends to identify itself;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: individual declarations signed and dated by each of the proposed senior person in charge, and qualified person in charge and any proposed alternate qualified person in charge, attesting that the person is not ineligible for a reason specified in section 16;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a document issued by a Canadian police force in relation to each person referred to in paragraph (b), indicating whether, during the 10 years before the day on which the application is submitted, the person was convicted as specified in subparagraph 16(a)(i) or received a sentence as specified in subparagraph 16(a)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if any of the persons referred to in paragraph (b) has ordinarily resided in a country other than Canada during the 10 years before the day on which the application is submitted, a document issued by a police force of that country indicating whether in that period that person was convicted as specified in subparagraph 16(b)(i) or received a sentence as specified in subparagraph 16(b)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a declaration, signed and dated by the proposed senior person in charge, attesting that the proposed qualified person in charge and any proposed alternate qualified person in charge have the knowledge and experience required under paragraphs 15(3)(c) and (d); and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if the proposed qualified person in charge or any proposed alternate qualified person in charge does not meet the requirement of subparagraph 15(3)(b)(i), either

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a copy of the person’s diploma, certificate or credential referred to in subparagraph 15(3)(b)(ii) or (iii), or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a detailed description of the education, training and work experience that is required under paragraph 15(4)(c), together with supporting evidence, such as a copy of a course transcript or an attestation by the person who provided the training.

Subsection.Text: The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by the proposed senior person in charge; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include an attestation by that person that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: all of the information and documents submitted in support of the application are correct and complete to the best of their knowledge, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: they have the authority to bind the applicant.

Subsection.Text: The applicant must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.

Section.Text: Subject to section 17.3, on completion of the review of the licence application, the Minister must issue a dealer’s licence, with or without terms and conditions, that contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licence number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the licensed dealer, their corporate name or the title of the position they hold;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the activities that are authorized and the specified names of the targeted substances in respect of which each activity may be conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the municipal address of the site at which the dealer may conduct the authorized activities;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the security level at the site, determined in accordance with the Security Directive;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date of the licence;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date of the licence, which must be not later than three years after its effective date;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: any terms and conditions that the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe are necessary to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure conformity with the requirements associated with the security level that is referred to in paragraph (e), or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a targeted substance being diverted to an illicit market or use; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: if the licensed dealer produces a targeted substance, the quantity that they may produce and the authorized production period.

Section.Text: A dealer’s licence is valid until the expiry date set out in the licence or, if it is earlier, the date of the suspension or revocation of the licence under section 23 or 24.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to issue a dealer’s licence if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant may not apply for a licence under section 13;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: during the 10 years before the day on which the licence application is submitted, the applicant has contravened

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a provision of the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a term or condition of a licence or permit issued to the applicant under any regulations made under the Act or issued to the applicant under the Cannabis Act or its regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: during the 10 years before the day on which the application is submitted, the proposed senior person in charge or qualified person in charge or any proposed alternate qualified person in charge was convicted as specified in subparagraph 16(a)(i) or (b)(i) or received a sentence as specified in subparagraph 16(a)(ii) or (b)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an activity for which the licence is requested would contravene an international obligation;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant does not have in place at the site the security measures set out in the Security Directive in respect of an activity for which the licence is requested;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the method referred to in paragraph 17(1)(j) does not permit the recording of information as required by section 40;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant has not complied with the requirements of subsection 17(4) or the information or documents that they have provided are not sufficient to complete the review of the licence application;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the applicant has submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the licence application;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: information received from a competent authority or the United Nations gives the Minister reasonable grounds to believe that the applicant has been involved in the diversion of a targeted substance to an illicit market or use or has been involved in an activity that contravenes an international obligation; or

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the issuance of the licence would likely create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a targeted substance being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must not refuse to issue a licence under paragraph (1)(b) or (h) if the applicant meets the following conditions, unless the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a targeted substance from being diverted to an illicit market or use:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant does not have a history of non-compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, the necessary corrective measures to ensure compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act and their regulations.

Subsection.Text: Before refusing to issue a licence, the Minister must send the applicant a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the applicant an opportunity to be heard.
To apply to renew a dealer’s licence, a licensed dealer must submit to the Minister an application that contains the information and documents referred to in subsections 17(1) and (2).
The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by the senior person in charge of the site specified in the application; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include an attestation by that person that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: all of the information and documents submitted in support of the application are correct and complete to the best of their knowledge, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: they have the authority to bind the licensed dealer.

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.
Subject to section 18.3, on completion of the review of the renewal application, the Minister must issue a renewed dealer’s licence that contains the information specified in section 17.1.
When renewing a dealer’s licence, the Minister may, if he or she has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so, add a term or condition to it or modify or delete one in order to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ensure conformity with the requirements associated with the security level specified in the licence or the new level required as a result of the licence renewal; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a targeted substance being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Section.Text: A renewed dealer’s licence is valid until the expiry date set out in the licence or, if it is earlier, the date of the suspension or revocation of the licence under section 23 or 24.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to renew a dealer’s licence if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer may no longer apply for a licence under section 13;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: during the 10 years before the day on which the renewal application is submitted, the licensed dealer has contravened

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a provision of the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a term or condition of a licence or permit issued to the dealer under a regulation made under the Act or issued to the dealer under the Cannabis Act or its regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: during the 10 years before the day on which the renewal application is submitted, the proposed senior person in charge or qualified person in charge or any proposed alternate qualified person in charge was convicted as specified in subparagraph 16(a)(i) or (b)(i) or received a sentence as specified in subparagraph 16(a)(ii) or (b)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an activity for which the renewal is requested would contravene an international obligation;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have in place at the site the security measures set out in the Security Directive in respect of an activity for which the renewal is requested;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the method referred to in paragraph 17(1)(j) does not permit the recording of information as required by section 40;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has not complied with the requirements of subsection 18(3) or the information or documents that they have provided are not sufficient to complete the review of the renewal application;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the renewal application;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: information received from a competent authority or the United Nations gives the Minister reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has been involved in the diversion of a targeted substance to an illicit market or use or has been involved in an activity that contravened an international obligation; or

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the renewal of the licence would likely create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a targeted substance being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must not refuse to renew a licence under paragraph (1)(b) or (h) if the licensed dealer meets the following conditions, unless the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a targeted substance from being diverted to an illicit market or use:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have a history of non-compliance with the Act or the Cannabis Act or their regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, the necessary corrective measures to ensure compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act and their regulations.

Subsection.Text: Before refusing to renew a licence, the Minister must send the licensed dealer a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard.

Before making a change affecting any information referred to in section 17.1 that is contained in their dealer’s licence, a licensed dealer must submit to the Minister an application to amend the licence that contains a description of the proposed amendment, as well as the information and documents referred to in section 17 that are relevant to the proposed amendment.
The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by the senior person in charge of the site specified in the application; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include an attestation by that person that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: all of the information and documents submitted in support of the application are correct and complete to the best of their knowledge, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: they have the authority to bind the licensed dealer.

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.
Subject to section 19.3, on completion of the review of the amendment application, the Minister must amend the dealer’s licence.
When amending a dealer’s licence, the Minister may, if he or she has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so, add a term or condition to it or modify or delete one in order to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ensure conformity with the requirements associated with the security level specified in the licence or the new level required as a result of the amendment; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a targeted substance being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Section.Text: An amended dealer’s licence is valid until the expiry date set out in the licence or, if it is earlier, the date of the suspension or revocation of the licence under section 23 or 24.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to amend a dealer’s licence if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an activity for which the amendment is requested would contravene an international obligation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have in place at the site the security measures set out in the Security Directive in respect of an activity for which the amendment is requested;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the method referred to in paragraph 17(1)(j) does not permit the recording of information as required by section 40;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has not complied with the requirements of subsection 19(3) or the information or documents that they have provided are not sufficient to complete the review of the amendment application;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the amendment application; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the amendment of the licence would likely create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a targeted substance being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must not refuse to amend a licence under paragraph (1)(e) if the licensed dealer meets the following conditions, unless the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a targeted substance from being diverted to an illicit market or use:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have a history of non-compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, the necessary corrective measures to ensure compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act and their Regulations.

Subsection.Text: Before refusing to amend a licence, the Minister must send the licensed dealer a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard.

Heading.TitleText: Changes Requiring Prior Approval by Minister

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must obtain the Minister’s approval before making any of the following changes by submitting a written application to the Minister:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a change affecting the security measures in place at the site specified in the dealer’s licence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the replacement of the senior person in charge;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the replacement of the qualified person in charge; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the replacement or addition of an alternate qualified person in charge.

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must provide the Minister with the following with respect to a change referred to in subsection (1):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a change affecting the security measures in place at the site specified in the dealer’s licence, details of the change;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the senior person in charge,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the information specified in paragraph 17(1)(c), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the declaration specified in paragraph 17(2)(b) and the documents specified in paragraphs 17(2)(c) and (d); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the information specified in paragraph 17(1)(d), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the declarations specified in paragraphs 17(2)(b) and (e) and the documents specified in paragraphs 17(2)(c), (d) and (f).

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.
Subject to section 20.2, on completion of the review of the application for approval of the change, the Minister must approve the change.
When approving a change, the Minister may, if he or she has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so, add a term or condition to the licence or modify or delete one in order to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ensure conformity with the requirements associated with the security level specified in the licence; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a targeted substance being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to approve the change if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: during the 10 years before the day on which the application for approval of the change is submitted, the proposed senior person in charge or qualified person in charge or any proposed alternate qualified person in charge was convicted as specified in subparagraph 16(a)(i) or (b)(i) or received a sentence as specified in subparagraph 16(a)(ii) or (b)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has not complied with the requirements of subsection 20(3) or the information or documents that they have provided are not sufficient to complete the review of the application for approval of the change;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the application for approval of the change; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the change would likely create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a targeted substance being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must not refuse to approve a change under paragraph (1)(c) if the licensed dealer has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, the necessary corrective measures to ensure compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act and their regulations, unless the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a targeted substance from being diverted to an illicit market or use.
Before refusing to approve a change, the Minister must send the licensed dealer a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard in respect of them.
A licensed dealer must notify the Minister in writing before

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: manufacturing or assembling a product or compound that is not set out in the most recent version of the list referred to in paragraph 17(1)(f) that has been submitted to the Minister; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: making a change to a product or compound that is set out in the list, if the change affects any of the information that has previously been submitted.

Subsection.Text: The notice must contain the information referred to in paragraph 17(1)(f) that is necessary to update the list and must be accompanied by the revised version of the list.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer must notify the Minister in writing within five days after a person ceases to act as the qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must notify the Minister in writing within 10 days after one of the following changes occurs:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a person ceases to act as the senior person in charge; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer ceases to manufacture or assemble a product or compound that is set out in the most recent version of the list referred to in paragraph 17(1)(f) that has been submitted to the Minister.

Subsection.Text: A notice submitted under paragraph (1)(b) must specify which information referred to in paragraph 17(1)(f) is being changed and must be accompanied by the revised version of the list.

A licensed dealer that intends to cease conducting activities at their site — whether on or before the expiry of their licence — must notify the Minister in writing to that effect at least 30 days before ceasing those activities.
The notice must be signed and dated by the senior person in charge and contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the expected date of the cessation of activities at the site;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the manner in which any remaining targeted substances on the site as of that date will be disposed of by the licensed dealer, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if some or all of them will be sold or provided to another licensed dealer that will be conducting activities at the same site, the name of that dealer,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if some or all of them will be sold or provided to another licensed dealer that will not be conducting activities at the same site, the name of that dealer and the municipal address of their site, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if some or all of them will be destroyed, the date on which and the municipal address of the location at which the destruction is to take place;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the municipal address of the location at which the licensed dealer’s documents will be kept after activities have ceased; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name, municipal address, telephone number and, if applicable, the email address of a person who the Minister may contact for further information after activities have ceased.

Subsection.Text: After having ceased to conduct the activities, the licensed dealer must submit to the Minister a detailed update of the information referred to in subsection (2) if it differs from what was set out in the notice. The update must be signed and dated by the senior person in charge.

Heading.TitleText: Changes to Terms and Conditions of Licence

Section.MarginalNote: Addition of or modification to term or condition

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, at any time other than at the issuance, renewal or amendment of a dealer’s licence, add a term or condition to it or modify one if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ensure conformity with the requirements associated with the security level specified in the licence; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a targeted substance being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: Before adding a term or condition to a licence or modifying one, the Minister must send the licensed dealer a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard.

Despite subsection (2), the Minister may add a term or condition to a licence or modify one without prior notice if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a targeted substance from being diverted to an illicit market or use.
The addition or modification of a term or condition that is made under subsection (3) takes effect as soon as the Minister sends the licensed dealer a notice that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sets out the reasons for the addition or modification;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, specifies the corrective measures that must be carried out and the date by which they must be carried out.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may delete a term or condition of a dealer’s licence that the Minister determines is no longer necessary.
The deletion takes effect as soon as the Minister sends the licensed dealer a notice to that effect.

The Minister must suspend a dealer’s licence without prior notice if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a targeted substance from being diverted to an illicit market or use.
The suspension takes effect as soon as the Minister sends the licensed dealer a notice that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sets out the reasons for the suspension;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, specifies the corrective measures that must be carried out and the date by which they must be carried out.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must reinstate the licence if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the suspension is no longer necessary.
Subject to subsection (2), the Minister must revoke a dealer’s licence if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer may no longer apply for a licence under section 13;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer requests the Minister to do so or informs the Minister of the loss or theft of the licence or the actual or potential unauthorized use of the licence;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer ceases to conduct activities at their site before the expiry of their licence;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not take the corrective measures specified in an undertaking or notice;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has contravened

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a provision of the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a term or condition of a licence or permit issued to the dealer under a regulation made under the Act or issued to the dealer under the Cannabis Act or its regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: during the 10 years before the day on which the licence is revoked, the senior person in charge, the qualified person in charge or any alternate qualified person in charge was convicted as specified in subparagraph 16(a)(i) or (b)(i) or received a sentence as specified in subparagraph 16(a)(ii) or (b)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of an application relating to the licence; or

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: information received from a competent authority or the United Nations gives the Minister reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has been involved in the diversion of a targeted substance to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must not revoke a dealer’s licence for a ground set out in paragraph (1)(e) or (g) if the licensed dealer meets the following conditions, unless the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a targeted substance from being diverted to an illicit market or use:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have a history of non-compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, the necessary corrective measures to ensure compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act and their regulations.

Subsection.Text: Before revoking a licence, the Minister must send the licensed dealer a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard.

Section.Text: The licensed dealer must return the original of the licence to the Minister within 15 days after the effective date of the revocation.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must submit to the Minister, before each importation of a targeted substance, an application for an import permit that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name, municipal address and dealer’s licence number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the targeted substance to be imported,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its specified name, as set out in the dealer’s licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a salt, the name of the salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its quantity, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a raw material, its purity and its anhydrous content;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the targeted substance is contained in a product to be imported,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name of the product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug identification number that has been assigned to the product under section C.01.014.2 of the Food and Drug Regulations, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the strength per unit of the targeted substance in the product, the number of units per package and the number of packages;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name and municipal address, in the country of export, of the exporter from whom the targeted substance is being obtained;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the customs office where the importation is anticipated; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: each proposed mode of transportation and any proposed country of transit or transhipment.

Subsection.Text: The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by the qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include an attestation by that person that all of the information submitted in support of the application is correct and complete to the best of their knowledge.

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.

Section.Text: Subject to section 25.4, on completion of the review of the import permit application, the Minister must issue to the licensed dealer an import permit that contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the permit number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information set out in subsection 25(1);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date of the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date of the permit, being the earlier of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a date specified by the Minister that is not more than 180 days after its effective date, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the expiry date of the dealer’s licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any terms and conditions that the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe are necessary to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a targeted substance being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Section.Text: An import permit is valid until the earliest of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date set out in the permit,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the suspension or revocation of the permit under section 26 or 27,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the suspension or revocation of the dealer’s licence under section 23 or 24, and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the suspension or revocation of the export permit that applies to the targeted substance to be imported and that is issued by the competent authority in the country of export.

Section.Text: If an import permit expires, the licensed dealer must return the original of the permit to the Minister within 15 days after its expiry.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to issue an import permit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer is not authorized by their dealer’s licence to import the relevant targeted substance or their licence will expire before the date of importation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the importation would contravene an international obligation;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have in place at the site the security measures set out in the Security Directive in respect of the importation;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has not complied with the requirements of subsection 25(3) or the information or documents that they have provided are not sufficient to complete the review of the permit application;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the permit application;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has been notified that their application to renew or amend their licence will be refused;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the importation would contravene the laws of the country of export or any country of transit or transhipment; or

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the issuance of the permit would likely create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a targeted substance being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: Before refusing to issue the import permit, the Minister must send the licensed dealer a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard.

Section.Text: The holder of an import permit must provide a copy of the permit to the customs office at the time of importation.

The holder of an import permit must provide the Minister, within 15 days after the day of release of the targeted substance specified in the permit in accordance with the Customs Act, with a declaration that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name and the numbers of their dealer’s licence and the import permit that applies to the targeted substance;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the targeted substance,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its specified name, as set out in the dealer’s licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a salt, the name of the salt, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its quantity;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the targeted substance is contained in a product that they have imported,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name of the product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug identification number that has been assigned to the product under section C.01.014.2 of the Food and Drug Regulations, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the strength per unit of the targeted substance in the product, the number of units per package and the number of packages; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the customs office from which the targeted substance was released and the date of the release.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must suspend an import permit without prior notice if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the dealer’s licence is suspended;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the suspension is necessary to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a targeted substance from being diverted to an illicit market or use; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the importation would contravene the laws of the country of export or any country of transit or transhipment.

Subsection.Text: The suspension takes effect as soon as the Minister sends the licensed dealer a notice that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sets out the reasons for the suspension;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, specifies the corrective measures that must be carried out and the date by which they must be carried out.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must reinstate the import permit if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the suspension is no longer necessary.
Subject to subsection (2), the Minister must revoke an import permit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer requests the Minister to do so or informs the Minister of the loss or theft of the permit or the actual or potential unauthorized use of the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not carry out the corrective measures specified by the Minister under paragraph 26(2)(c) by the specified date;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has contravened a term or condition of the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the application for the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: information received from a competent authority or the United Nations gives the Minister reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has been involved in the diversion of a targeted substance to an illicit market or use; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the dealer’s licence has been revoked.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must not revoke an import permit for a ground set out in paragraph (1)(d) or 24(1)(e) or (g) if the licensed dealer meets the following conditions, unless the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a targeted substance from being diverted to an illicit market or use:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have a history of non-compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, the necessary corrective measures to ensure compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act and their regulations.

Subsection.Text: Before revoking an import permit, the Minister must send the licensed dealer a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard.

Section.Text: If an import permit is revoked, the licensed dealer must return the original of the permit to the Minister within 15 days after the effective date of the revocation.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must submit to the Minister, before each exportation of a targeted substance, an application for an export permit that contains the following information and document:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name, municipal address and dealer’s licence number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the targeted substance to be exported,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its specified name, as set out in the dealer’s licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a salt, the name of the salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its quantity, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a raw material, its purity and its anhydrous content;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the targeted substance is contained in a product to be exported,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name of the product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug identification number that has been assigned to the product under section C.01.014.2 of the Food and Drug Regulations, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the strength per unit of the targeted substance in the product, the number of units per package and the number of packages; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name and municipal address of the importer in the country of final destination;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the customs office where the exportation is anticipated;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: each proposed mode of transportation and any proposed country of transit or transhipment; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the import permit issued by the competent authority in the country of final destination that sets out the name of the importer and the municipal address of their site in that country.

Subsection.Text: The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by the qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include an attestation by that person that, to the best of their knowledge,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the exportation does not contravene the laws of the country of final destination or any country of transit or transhipment, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: all of the information and documents submitted in support of the application are correct and complete.

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.

Section.Text: Subject to section 28.4, on completion of the review of the export permit application, the Minister must issue to the licensed dealer an export permit that contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the permit number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information set out in paragraphs 28(1)(a) to (f);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date of the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date of the permit, being the earliest of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a date specified by the Minister that is not more than 180 days after its effective date,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the expiry date of the dealer’s licence, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the expiry date of the import permit issued by the competent authority in the country of final destination; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any terms and conditions that the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe are necessary to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a targeted substance being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Section.Text: An export permit is valid until the earliest of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date set out in the permit,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the suspension or revocation of the permit under section 29 or 30,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the suspension or revocation of the dealer’s licence under section 23 or 24, and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the expiry, suspension or revocation of the import permit that applies to the targeted substance to be exported and that is issued by the competent authority in the country of final destination.

Section.Text: If an export permit expires, the licensed dealer must return the original of the permit to the Minister within 15 days after its expiry.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to issue an export permit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer is not authorized by their dealer’s licence to export the relevant targeted substance or their dealer’s licence will expire before the date of export;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the exportation would contravene an international obligation;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has not complied with the requirements of subsection 28(3) or the information or documents that they have provided are not sufficient to complete the review of the permit application;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the permit application;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has been notified that their application to renew or amend their licence will be refused;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the exportation would not be in conformity with the import permit issued by the competent authority of the country of final destination;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the exportation would contravene the laws of the country of final destination or any country of transit or transhipment; or

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the issuance of the permit would likely create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a targeted substance being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: Before refusing to issue the export permit, the Minister must send the licensed dealer a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard.

Section.Text: The holder of an export permit must provide a copy of the permit to the customs office at the time of exportation.

The holder of an export permit must provide the Minister, within 15 days after the day of export of the targeted substance specified in the permit, with a declaration that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name and the numbers of their dealer’s licence and the export permit that applies to the targeted substance;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the targeted substance,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its specified name, as set out in the dealer’s licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a salt, the name of the salt, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its quantity;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the targeted substance is contained in a product that they have exported,
