Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name of the product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug identification number that has been assigned to the product under section C.01.014.2 of the Food and Drug Regulations, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the strength per unit of the targeted substance in the product, the number of units per package and the number of packages; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the customs office from which the targeted substance was exported and the date of export.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must suspend an export permit without prior notice if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the dealer’s licence is suspended;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the suspension is necessary to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a targeted substance from being diverted to an illicit market or use; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the exportation would contravene the laws of the country of final destination, or any country of transit or transhipment.

Subsection.Text: The suspension takes effect as soon as the Minister sends the licensed dealer a notice that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sets out the reasons for the suspension;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, specifies the corrective measures that must be carried out and the date by which they must be carried out.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must reinstate the export permit if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the suspension is no longer necessary.
Subject to subsection (2), the Minister must revoke an export permit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer requests the Minister to do so or informs the Minister of the loss or theft of the permit or the actual or potential unauthorized use of the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not carry out the corrective measures specified by the Minister under paragraph 29(2)(c) by the specified date;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has contravened a term or condition of the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the application for the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: information received from a competent authority or the United Nations gives the Minister reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has been involved in the diversion of a targeted substance to an illicit market or use; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the dealer’s licence has been revoked.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must not revoke an export permit for a ground set out in paragraph (1)(d) or 24(1)(e) or (g) if the licensed dealer meets the following conditions, unless the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a targeted substance from being diverted to an illicit market or use:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have a history of non-compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, the necessary corrective measures to ensure compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act and their regulations.

Subsection.Text: Before revoking an export permit, the Minister must send the licensed dealer a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard.

Section.Text: If an export permit is revoked, the licensed dealer must return the original of the permit to the Minister within 15 days after the effective date of the revocation.

A licensed dealer must include their name, as set out in their dealer’s licence, on all the means by which they identify themself in regard to their activities in relation to targeted substances, including labels, orders, shipping documents, invoices and advertising.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), a licensed dealer may sell or provide a targeted substance to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: another licensed dealer;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a pharmacist;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a practitioner;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a hospital;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a person to whom an exemption relating to the substance has been granted under section 56 of the Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exception — pharmacist or practitioner named in notice
Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must not sell or provide a targeted substance to a pharmacist or practitioner named in a notice issued under section 79, unless the dealer has received a notice of retraction issued under section 80.

A licensed dealer may sell or provide a targeted substance in accordance with section 32 if the dealer has received from one of the following persons a written or verbal order indicating the specified name and the quantity of the substance and, in the case of a written order, the conditions specified in subsection (2) are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a licensed dealer, a person who is authorized to place an order for the substance on their behalf;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a hospital, the pharmacist in charge of the hospital’s pharmacy or a practitioner authorized by the person in charge of the hospital to sign the order; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, the person to whom the substance is to be sold or provided.

Subsection.Text: The following conditions apply to a written order:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it must be signed and dated by one of the persons referred to in subsection (1); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer must verify the signature if it is unknown to them.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer may sell or provide a targeted substance more than once in respect of one order if the order indicates

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the number of sales or provisions, not exceeding four;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the specific quantity for each sale or provision; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the intervals between each sale and provision.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer may sell or provide a targeted substance more than once in respect of one order if, at the time of receipt of the order, the dealer temporarily does not have in stock the quantity of the substance ordered, in which case the dealer may sell or provide against the order the quantity of the substance that the dealer has available and deliver the balance later.

A licensed dealer that sells or provides a targeted substance must securely package it in its immediate container, which must be sealed in such a manner that the container cannot be opened without breaking the seal.
A licensed dealer that transports or exports a targeted substance must ensure that its package is sealed in such a manner that the package cannot be opened without breaking the seal.
Subsection (1) does not apply to a test kit that contains a targeted substance and that has a registration number.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer must, in taking delivery of a targeted substance that they have imported or in making delivery of a targeted substance,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: take any measures that are necessary to ensure the security of the targeted substance while it is being transported;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an imported targeted substance, transport it directly to the site specified in their licence after it is released under the Customs Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a targeted substance that is to be exported, transport it directly from the site specified in their licence to the customs office where it will be exported.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer must take any measures that are necessary to ensure the security of any targeted substance in their possession and any licence or permit in their possession.

Section.MarginalNote: Theft or loss — licences and permits
Section.Text: A licensed dealer that becomes aware of a theft or loss of their licence or permit must provide a written report to the Minister within 72 hours after becoming aware of it.

Section.MarginalNote: Theft or unexplainable loss — targeted substances
Section.Text: A licensed dealer that becomes aware of a theft of a targeted substance or of a loss of a targeted substance that cannot be explained on the basis of normally accepted business activities must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provide a written report to a member of a police force within 24 hours after becoming aware of the theft or loss; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provide a written report to the Minister within 72 hours after becoming aware of the theft or loss and include a confirmation that the report required under paragraph (a) has been provided.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must provide a written report containing the following information to the Minister within 72 hours after becoming aware of a transaction occurring in the course of their activities that they have reasonable grounds to suspect may be related to the diversion of a targeted substance to an illicit market or use:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name, municipal address, telephone number and, if the licensed dealer is a corporation, the position held by the individual making the report;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and municipal address of the other party to the transaction;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: details of the transaction, including its date and time, its type, the specified name and quantity of the targeted substance and, in the case of a product or compound, the quantity of every targeted substance that it contains;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a product that contains the targeted substance, other than a test kit, the drug identification number that is assigned to the product under section C.01.014.2 of the Food and Drug Regulations, if any; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of the reasons for those suspicions.

Subsection.Text: No civil proceedings lie against a licensed dealer for having provided the report in good faith.

A licensed dealer must not disclose that they have provided the report or disclose details of it, with the intent to prejudice a criminal investigation, whether or not a criminal investigation has begun.

Section.Text: A report made under any of sections 35.1 to 35.3, or any evidence derived from it, is not to be used or received to incriminate the licensed dealer in any criminal proceeding against them other than a prosecution under section 132, 136 or 137 of the Criminal Code.
A licensed dealer that intends to destroy a targeted substance at the site specified in their licence must ensure that the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer obtains the prior approval of the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the destruction is carried out in the presence of two of the following persons, at least one of whom must be a person referred to in subparagraph (i):

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the senior person in charge, the qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a person who works for or provides services to the licensed dealer and holds a senior position;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the destruction is carried out in accordance with a method that complies with all federal, provincial and municipal environmental protection legislation applicable to the place of destruction; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: as soon as the destruction is completed, the person who carried out the destruction and each of the two persons referred to in paragraph (b) who were present at the destruction sign and date a joint declaration attesting that the targeted substance was completely destroyed, to which each signatory must add their name in printed letters.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer that intends to destroy a targeted substance elsewhere than at the site specified in their licence must ensure that the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer obtains the prior approval of the Minister to carry out the destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer takes any measures that are necessary to ensure the security of the targeted substance while it is being transported in order to prevent its diversion to an illicit market or use;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the destruction is carried out by a person working for a business that specializes in the destruction of dangerous goods and in the presence of another person working for that business;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the destruction is carried out in accordance with a method that complies with all federal, provincial and municipal environmental protection legislation applicable to the place of destruction; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: as soon as the destruction is completed, the person who carried out the destruction provides the licensed dealer with a dated declaration attesting that the targeted substance was completely destroyed and containing

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the municipal address of the place of destruction,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the specified name and quantity of the targeted substance and, if applicable, the brand name and quantity of the product containing it or the name and quantity of the compound containing it,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the method of destruction,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of destruction, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the names in printed letters and signatures of that person and the other person who was present at the destruction.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must submit to the Minister an application that contains the following information in order to obtain the Minister’s prior approval to destroy a targeted substance:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name, municipal address and dealer’s licence number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed date of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the municipal address of the place of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a brief description of the method of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if the destruction is to be carried out at the site specified in the dealer’s licence, the names of the persons proposed for the purpose of paragraph 36(b) and information establishing that they meet the conditions of that paragraph;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the specified name of the targeted substance and, if applicable, the brand name of the product containing it or the name of the compound containing it; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the form and quantity of the targeted substance or the product or compound containing it and, if applicable, the strength per unit of the targeted substance in the product or compound, the number of units per package and the number of packages.

Subsection.Text: The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by the qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include an attestation by that person that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the proposed method of destruction complies with all federal, provincial and municipal environmental protection legislation applicable to the place of destruction, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: all of the information submitted in support of the application is correct and complete to the best of the signatory’s knowledge.

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.

Section.Text: On completion of the review of the approval application, the Minister must approve the destruction of the targeted substance unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a destruction that is to be carried out at the site specified in the dealer’s licence, the persons proposed for the purpose of paragraph 36(b) do not meet the conditions of that paragraph;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the targeted substance would not be destroyed;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the approval application;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the targeted substance or a portion of it is required for the purposes of a criminal or administrative investigation or a preliminary inquiry, trial or other proceeding under any Act or its regulations; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the approval would likely create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of the targeted substance being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer must record any information that they are required to record under these Regulations using a method that permits an audit of it to be made at any time.
A licensed dealer must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the specified name, the form and the quantity of any targeted substance that the dealer orders, the name of the person who placed the order on the dealer’s behalf and the date of the order;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the specified name, the form and the quantity of any targeted substance that the dealer receives, the name and municipal address of the person who sold or provided it and the date on which it was received;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a targeted substance that the dealer sells or provides,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name of the product or the name of the compound containing the targeted substance and the specified name of the targeted substance,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug identification number that has been assigned to the product under section C.01.014.2 of the Food and Drug Regulations, if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the form and quantity of the targeted substance and, if applicable, the strength per unit of the targeted substance in the product or compound, the number of units per package and the number of packages,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and municipal address of the person to whom it was sold or provided, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which it was sold or provided;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the specified name, the form and the quantity of any targeted substance that the dealer produces and the date on which it was placed in stock and, if applicable, the strength per unit of the targeted substance in the product or compound, the number of units per package and the number of packages;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the specified name and the quantity of any targeted substance that the dealer uses in the manufacturing or assembling of a product or compound, as well as the brand name and quantity of the product or the name and quantity of the compound, and the date on which the product or compound was placed in stock;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the specified name, the form and the quantity of any targeted substance in stock at the end of each month;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the specified name, the form and the quantity of any targeted substance that the dealer delivers, transports or sends, the name and municipal address of the consignee and the date on which it was delivered, transported or sent;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the specified name, the form and the quantity of any targeted substance that the dealer imports, the date on which it was imported, the name and municipal address of the exporter, the country of exportation and any country of transit or transhipment; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the specified name, the form and the quantity of any targeted substance that the dealer exports, the date on which it was exported, the name and municipal address of the importer, the country of final destination and any country of transit or transhipment.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer that receives a verbal order for a targeted substance must immediately record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person who placed the order;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the order was received; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person recording the order.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer that becomes aware of a loss of a targeted substance that can be explained on the basis of normally accepted business activities must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the lost targeted substance and, if applicable, the brand name of the product or the name of the compound containing it;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the form and quantity of the targeted substance and, if applicable, the form of the product or compound containing it, the strength per unit of the targeted substance in the product or compound, the number of units per package and the number of packages;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the dealer became aware of the loss; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the explanation for the loss.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer must record the following information concerning any targeted substance that they destroy at the site specified in their licence:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the municipal address of the place of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the specified name, the form and the quantity of the targeted substance and, if applicable, the brand name and quantity of the product containing the targeted substance or the name and quantity of the compound containing the targeted substance;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the method of destruction; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of destruction.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), a licensed dealer must provide to the Minister, within three months after the end of each calendar year, an annual report that contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the specified name, the form and the total quantity of each targeted substance that they receive, produce, assemble, sell, provide, import, export or destroy during the calendar year, as well as the name and total quantity of each targeted substance that they use to manufacture or assemble a product or compound;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the specified name, the form and the quantity of each targeted substance in physical inventory taken at the site specified in their licence at the end of the calendar year; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the specified name, the form and the quantity of any targeted substance that has been lost or stolen in the course of conducting activities during the calendar year.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Non-renewal or revocation within first three months
Subsection.Text: If a licensed dealer’s licence expires without being renewed or is revoked during the first three months of a calendar year, the dealer must provide to the Minister

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: within three months after the end of the preceding calendar year, the annual report in respect of that year; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: within three months after the expiry or revocation, a report in respect of the portion of the current calendar year during which the licence was valid that contains the information referred to in subsection (1), in which the quantity in physical inventory is to be calculated as of the date of expiry or revocation.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Non-renewal or revocation after third month
Subsection.Text: If a licensed dealer’s licence expires without being renewed or is revoked after the first three months of a calendar year, the dealer must provide to the Minister, within three months after the expiry or revocation, a report in respect of the portion of the calendar year during which the licence was valid that contains the information referred to in subsection (1) for that period, in which the quantity in physical inventory is to be calculated as of the date of expiry or revocation.

Section.Text: Sections 49 to 56 do not apply to a pharmacist when they are practising in a hospital.
A pharmacist may, in accordance with sections 50 to 57, compound a targeted substance in accordance with a prescription.

Section.MarginalNote: Record of receipt from licensed dealer
Section.Text: If a pharmacist receives a targeted substance from a licensed dealer, a pharmacist in another pharmacy or a hospital, the pharmacist must keep a record of the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name of the targeted substance received or, if the targeted substance does not have a brand name, the specified name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity and strength per unit of the targeted substance received, the number of units per package and the number of packages;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the licensed dealer, pharmacist or hospital that supplied it; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which it was received.

Subsection.Text: In addition to the activities authorized under section 55, a pharmacist may, subject to section 52, sell, provide, send, deliver or transport a targeted substance to or for an individual or for the benefit of an animal if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist sells or provides the substance in a container labelled in accordance with subsection (2);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the transaction is made pursuant to a prescription

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: dated and signed by a practitioner,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: provided verbally to the pharmacist by a practitioner, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: transferred to the pharmacist under subsection 54(1) in accordance with subsection 54(2);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist has not transferred the prescription to another pharmacist; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: when the prescription has been provided verbally, the transaction is recorded by the pharmacist in accordance with subsection (3).

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist who sells or provides a targeted substance to an individual must do so in a container that is labelled with the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the pharmacy or pharmacist;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of issuance of the prescription and the number given to it by the pharmacist;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the individual for whose benefit the targeted substance is sold or provided or, if it is sold or provided for the benefit of an animal, the name of the individual having caring of the animal or the name of the animal;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the practitioner who issued the prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the specified name or brand name of the targeted substance;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity and, if applicable, the strength per unit of the targeted substance; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the directions for use specified by the practitioner.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist who receives a verbal prescription for a targeted substance must, before filling it,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: record the following information:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the individual for whose benefit the prescription is provided or, if it is provided for the benefit of an animal, the name and address of the individual having caring of the animal and, if applicable, the name of the animal,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date that the verbal prescription was provided,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the specified name or brand name of the targeted substance, as specified in the prescription,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity and, if applicable, the strength per unit of the targeted substance,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the recording pharmacist and the name of the practitioner who issued the prescription,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the directions for use specified by the practitioner, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the prescription is to be refilled, the number of times it may be refilled and, if specified, the interval between refills; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: keep a hard copy or create a written record of the prescription.

Section.Text: A pharmacist may only refill a prescription for a targeted substance if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the practitioner who prescribed it expressly directs that the prescription may be refilled and specifies the number of refills;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist makes a record of each refill in accordance with section 53;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: less than one year has elapsed since the day on which the prescription was issued by the practitioner;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: at least one refill remains on the prescription; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where an interval between refills has been specified by the practitioner, it has expired.

Section.Text: A pharmacist who fills or refills a prescription for a targeted substance must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date the prescription was filled or refilled;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the targeted substance provided at the original filling and at each refill;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist’s name or initials; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the number assigned to the prescription.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist may transfer a prescription for a targeted substance to another pharmacist, except a prescription that has already been transferred.
Before a pharmacist sells or provides a targeted substance to an individual under a prescription transferred under subsection (1), the pharmacist must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a verbal transfer, record the information required by subsection 51(3);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a written transfer, have obtained from the transferring pharmacist a copy of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the prescription written by the practitioner, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the record made in accordance with subsection 51(3) of the practitioner’s verbal prescription; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in all cases, record

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the transferring pharmacist,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of authorized refills remaining and, if applicable, the specified interval between refills, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of the last refill.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist who transfers a prescription under subsection (1) must record the date of the transfer, the name of the pharmacist to whom the prescription was transferred, the name and address of the pharmacy where that pharmacist practises and, if applicable, the number of refills that are being transferred.

A pharmacist may sell, provide, send, deliver or transport a targeted substance without a prescription to any of the following persons on receipt of an order from that person that specifies the name and quantity of the targeted substance:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the order is written, a licensed dealer who

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: sold or provided the targeted substance, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is licensed to destroy targeted substances, other than those that the licensed dealer produced, made, assembled, sold or provided;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: subject to subsection (2),

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a practitioner,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: another pharmacist, if the other pharmacist states that the targeted substance is required because of a delay or shortfall in an order for the targeted substance placed with a licensed dealer, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a hospital, if the order is placed by a pharmacist practising in the hospital or by a practitioner who is authorized to order the targeted substance on behalf of the hospital;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister, if the order is a written order signed on the Minister’s behalf; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a person to whom an exemption with respect to the targeted substance has been granted under section 56 of the Act, if the order is a written order and is accompanied by a copy of the exemption.

Subsection.Text: In the circumstances set out in subparagraphs (1)(b)(i) to (iii), if the order is verbal, the pharmacist must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the pharmacist or practitioner placing the order;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the order was placed on behalf of an establishment, the name and address of the establishment;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the order;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the specified name or the brand name of the targeted substance ordered, as specified in the order;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity and, if applicable, the strength per unit of the targeted substance; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the recording pharmacist.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist who sells, provides, sends, delivers or transports a targeted substance without a prescription must keep a record of the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name of the targeted substance or, if the targeted substance does not have a brand name, the specified name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity and strength per unit of the targeted substance;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the person referred to in subsection (1) to whom the targeted substance was sold, provided, sent, delivered or transported; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the transaction.

Subsection.Text: The pharmacist must keep the written order or, if the order is verbal, must create a hard copy of the order.

Section.Text: A pharmacist who closes premises in which a targeted substance has been stored must, not later than 10 days after the closure, inform the Minister of the date of closure, the location to which the targeted substance was moved and the quantity of the targeted substance that was moved.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist who does not wish to receive or have possession of targeted substances may make a written request to the Minister to send to licensed dealers and pharmacies a notice, issued under section 79, that states that targeted substances must not be supplied to that pharmacist.
A pharmacist must not, unless their pharmacy has received a retraction issued under section 80,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sell or provide a targeted substance to a pharmacist or practitioner named in a notice issued under section 79; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: fill a prescription or order for a targeted substance from a practitioner named in a notice issued under section 79.

Section.Text: A practitioner may, with respect to a targeted substance, prescribe it for or administer it to an individual or animal, or sell, provide, send, deliver or transport it to or for an individual or for the benefit of an animal, only if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the individual or animal is a patient that the practitioner is treating in their professional capacity; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the targeted substance is required to treat the individual’s or animal’s medical condition.

Subsection.Text: A practitioner of medicine may store an emergency supply of targeted substances at a remote location where emergency medical treatment is not readily available or in an emergency medical service vehicle, if the practitioner has an agent or mandatary at that location or in the vehicle who will control and administer the targeted substances on behalf of, and under the direction of, the practitioner.
When aid is being provided to an individual in an emergency, the agent or mandatary of the practitioner of medicine may administer a targeted substance from the emergency supply to the individual if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the practitioner of medicine has, by telephone or other means, directed the agent or mandatary to administer the targeted substance; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the agent or mandatary follows written directives provided by the practitioner with respect to the administration of the targeted substance.

Subsection.Text: A practitioner must keep the following records:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name or, if the targeted substance does not have a brand name, the specified name, the quantity and strength per unit of any targeted substance received from a licensed dealer, pharmacist or hospital and the date on which it is received;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the licensed dealer, pharmacist or hospital that sold or provided the targeted substance;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if a transaction involves a quantity of targeted substance that exceeds five times the usual daily dose for the substance, the name and quantity of the substance prescribed, administered, sold, provided, sent, delivered or transported, the name and address of the recipient and the date of the transaction; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an emergency supply referred to in subsection 59(1), the name of the administering agent or mandatary, the location of the emergency supply, the name, quantity and strength per unit of each targeted substance, the date of all transactions related to that emergency supply and the name of any individual to whom the targeted substance was administered.

Subsection.Text: In respect of the administration of a targeted substance from an emergency supply referred to in subsection 59(1), the agent or mandatary of the practitioner must keep the following records:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, strength per unit and quantity of each targeted substance administered and the date on which it was administered;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the individual to whom the targeted substance was administered; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the agent or mandatary of the practitioner who administered the targeted substance.

Subsection.Text: An agent or mandatary of a practitioner of medicine referred to in subsection 59(1) must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: take reasonable steps to protect any targeted substance in their possession from loss and theft; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: inform the practitioner without delay of any loss or theft of a targeted substance.

Subsection.Text: A practitioner of medicine who is informed by their agent or mandatary of the loss or theft of a targeted substance must inform the Minister in accordance with subsection 72(2).

Section.Text: A practitioner who does not wish to receive or have possession of targeted substances may make a written request to the Minister to send to licensed dealers and pharmacies a notice issued under section 79 that states that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: recipients of the notice must not sell or provide any targeted substance to that practitioner; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: pharmacists practising in the notified pharmacies must not fill a prescription or order for any targeted substance provided by that practitioner.

Subsection.Text: A hospital may, in accordance with subsection (2) and sections 64 to 67, sell, provide, administer, send, deliver or transport a targeted substance.

No person may order a targeted substance on behalf of a hospital other than a pharmacist or practitioner practising in the hospital who is authorized by the person in charge of the hospital to order targeted substances for the hospital.

Section.MarginalNote: Provision or administration to a patient
Section.Text: The person in charge of a hospital must not permit a targeted substance to be sold, provided or administered to a patient or animal under treatment as an in-patient or an out-patient of the hospital except pursuant to a prescription or other authorization of a practitioner practising in the hospital.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist practising in a hospital or an individual who is authorized by the person in charge of a hospital to fill orders for targeted substances on behalf of the hospital may, on receipt of an order specifying the name, quantity and, if applicable, strength per unit of a targeted substance from any of the following persons, sell or provide the targeted substance to that person without a prescription:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: subject to subsection (2),

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a licensed dealer who

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: sold or provided the substance, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: is licensed to destroy targeted substances other than those that the licensed dealer produced, made, assembled, sold or provided,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a practitioner, if the practitioner states that the substance is required because of a delay or shortfall in an order for the substance placed with a licensed dealer or pharmacist,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a pharmacist, if the pharmacist states that the substance is required because of a delay or shortfall in an order for the substance placed with a licensed dealer, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: another hospital, if the order is placed by a pharmacist practising in the other hospital or a practitioner who is authorized to order the targeted substance on behalf of the other hospital and the order states that the substance is required because of a delay or shortfall in an order placed with a licensed dealer or a pharmacist;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister, if the order is a written order signed on the Minister’s behalf; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a person to whom an exemption with respect to the targeted substance has been granted under section 56 of the Act, if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the person is an employee of or associated with the hospital, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the order is a written order accompanied by a copy of the exemption.

Subsection.Text: In the circumstances set out in paragraph (1)(a), if the order is verbal, the pharmacist practising in the hospital or the individual who is authorized by the person in charge of the hospital to fill orders for the targeted substance on behalf of the hospital must, before filling the order, record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the order was received;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the person placing the order;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name of the targeted substance or, if the targeted substance does not have a brand name, the specified name;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the targeted substance ordered; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: their name.

Section.Text: The person in charge of a hospital must record, or cause to be recorded, the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name or, if the targeted substance does not have a brand name, the specified name, the quantity of any targeted substance received by the hospital and the date on which it was received;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the licensed dealer, pharmacist or other hospital that sold or provided the targeted substance;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and quantity of the targeted substance sold, provided, administered, sent, delivered or transported, the name and address of the recipient and the date of the transaction; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of any out-patient to whom a targeted substance is sold or provided under section 64.

Section.Text: If a targeted substance is stored in a hospital or the pharmacy department of a hospital and the hospital or department closes, the person in charge of the hospital must, not later than 10 days after the day of the closure, inform the Minister of the date of closure, the location to which the targeted substance was moved and the quantity of the targeted substance that was moved.

Subsection.Text: An individual who is a resident of Canada may, at the time of the individual’s return to Canada from a foreign country, import a targeted substance that is in their possession at the time of entry if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the substance has been obtained under a prescription and is labelled with the information set out in paragraphs 51(2)(a) to (g);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the individual is importing the substance

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for their own use,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for the use of a person for whom the individual is responsible and who is travelling with them, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: for the use of an animal for which the individual is responsible and that is travelling with them;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the substance is imported to meet the medical needs of the individual or animal for whose benefit it is prescribed;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the substance is declared to a customs office at the port of entry into Canada at the time of import; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity being imported does not exceed the lesser of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a single course of treatment, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a 90-day supply, based on the usual daily dose.

Subsection.Text: An individual who is a resident of a foreign country may, at the time that the individual enters Canada, import a targeted substance that is in their possession at the time of entry if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the requirements set out in paragraphs (1)(a) to (d) are met; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity imported is the least of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the content of the container,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a 90-day supply, based on the usual daily dose, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the usual daily dose multiplied by the number of days that the individual will stay in Canada.

Section.Text: An individual may, at the time of their departure from Canada, export a targeted substance that is in their possession at the time of departure if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the substance has been obtained under a prescription and is labelled with the information set out in paragraphs 51(2)(a) to (g);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the individual is exporting the substance

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for their own use,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for the use of a person for whom the individual is responsible and who is travelling with them, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: for the use of an animal for which the individual is responsible and that is travelling with them;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the substance is required to meet the medical needs of the individual or animal for whose benefit it is prescribed; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity exported does not exceed the lesser of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a single course of treatment, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a 90-day supply, based on the usual daily dose.

Section.Text: Every person who fills an order or prescription for a targeted substance must verify the identity of the person who gave the order or issued the prescription if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the signature on the order or prescription is unknown to the person; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the order or prescription is verbal and the person placing it is not known to the person.

Section.Text: Subject to section 59, every person who is authorized under these Regulations to deal in a targeted substance and who stores the targeted substance must do so in the place used for the purpose of conducting their business or professional practice and in the area in that place where only authorized employees have access, except if the targeted substance is for their own use or the use of another person for whom, or an animal for which, they are responsible.

Subsection.Text: The following persons must take any measures that are necessary to ensure the security of any targeted substance in their possession:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a pharmacist;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a practitioner;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the person in charge of a hospital;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a person to whom an exemption has been granted under section 56 of the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a person who, in accordance with a permit for transit or transhipment, is responsible for the targeted substance while it is in transit or in transhipment in Canada.

Subsection.Text: A person referred to in subsection (1) who becomes aware of a theft or loss of a targeted substance must provide a written report to the Minister within 10 days after becoming aware of the occurrence.

Subject to subsection (2) and sections 36 and 37, a person must not destroy a targeted substance unless they have received it in accordance with these Regulations for their own use or the use of another person for whom, or an animal for which, they are responsible.
A pharmacist, a practitioner or the person in charge of a hospital may destroy a targeted substance if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: subject to subsection (3), the destruction is witnessed by a pharmacist or practitioner;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the targeted substance is destroyed using a method that complies with all federal, provincial and municipal environmental protection legislation applicable to the place of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: they record the following information:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the municipal address of the place of destruction,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the specified name of the targeted substance to be destroyed and, if applicable, the brand name of the product containing it or the name of the compound containing it,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the form and quantity of the targeted substance to be destroyed or the product or compound containing it and, if applicable, its strength per unit, the number of units per package and the number of packages,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the method of destruction, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of the destruction; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: immediately following the destruction, the person who carried out the destruction and the pharmacist or practitioner who witnessed it sign and date a joint declaration attesting that the targeted substance was completely destroyed, to which each signatory must add their name in printed letters.

Subsection.Text: A targeted substance that constitutes the remainder of an open ampule, the partial contents of which have been administered to a patient, may be destroyed by a hospital employee who is a licensed health professional without a witness.

Section.Text: A person must not make any mark on or alter or deface in any manner any licence, permit or registration number issued under these Regulations.

A person must keep any document containing all of the information that they are required to record under these Regulations, including every declaration and a copy of every report, for a period of two years following the day on which the last record is recorded in the document and in a manner that permits an audit of the document to be made at any time.
The documents must be kept

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a licensed dealer, at the site specified in their licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a former licensed dealer or any other person, at a location in Canada.

Section.Text: The documents must be complete and readily retrievable and the information in them must be legible and indelible.
It is prohibited to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: advertise a targeted substance to the general public; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: publish any written advertisement respecting a targeted substance unless the advertisement

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is published in literature distributed to, or in a trade publication for, licensed dealers, pharmacists, practitioners or hospitals, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: displays the following symbol in a clear and conspicuous colour and size in the upper left quarter of its first page:

ImageGroup.AlternateText: The symbol consists of a square outline divided in half from top left corner to bottom right corner. An uppercase letter C appears in the centre of the top right half and an uppercase letter T appears in the centre of the lower left half.

Subsection.Text: In the circumstances described in subsection (2), the Minister must send a notice to the persons and authorities specified in subsection (3) advising them that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: pharmacists practising in the notified pharmacies and all licensed dealers must not sell or provide any targeted substance to the pharmacist or the practitioner named in the notice;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: pharmacists practising in the notified pharmacies must not fill an order or prescription for any targeted substance provided by the practitioner named in the notice; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the prohibitions in both paragraphs (a) and (b) apply with respect to the practitioner named in the notice.

Subsection.Text: The notice must be sent if the pharmacist or practitioner named in the notice has

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: made a request to the Minister in accordance with subsection 57(1) or section 62 to send the notice;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contravened a rule of conduct established by the provincial professional licensing authority in the province in which the pharmacist or practitioner is practising and the authority has requested the Minister in writing to send the notice; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: been convicted of a designated substance offence or of a contravention of these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: The notice must be sent to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: all licensed dealers;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: all pharmacies within the province in which the pharmacist or practitioner named in the notice is registered and entitled to practise and is practising;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the provincial professional licensing authority of the province in which the pharmacist or practitioner named in the notice is registered and entitled to practise;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: all pharmacies in an adjacent province in which a prescription or order from the pharmacist or practitioner named in the notice may be filled; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any provincial professional licensing authority in another province that has requested the Minister in writing to send the notice.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may send the notice described in subsection (1) to the persons and authorities specified in subsection (3) if the Minister has taken the measures specified in subsection (5) and has reasonable grounds to believe that the pharmacist or practitioner named in the notice

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has contravened a provision of the Act or these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has, on more than one occasion, self-administered a targeted substance under a self-directed prescription or order or, in the absence of a prescription or order, contrary to accepted professional practice;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has, on more than one occasion, prescribed, administered or provided a targeted substance to a person who is a spouse, common-law partner, parent or child of the pharmacist or practitioner, including a child adopted in fact, contrary to accepted professional practice; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: is unable to account for a quantity of targeted substance for which the pharmacist or practitioner was responsible under these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: The measures that must be taken before sending the notice are that the Minister has

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: consulted with the provincial professional licensing authority of the province in which the pharmacist or practitioner to whom the notice relates is registered and entitled to practise;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: given that pharmacist or practitioner an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: considered

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the compliance history of the pharmacist or practitioner in respect of the Act and its regulations, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: whether the actions of the pharmacist or practitioner pose a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of the targeted substance being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Section.MarginalNote: Prohibition of sale — notice of retraction
Section.Text: The Minister must provide the persons and authorities who were sent a notice under subsection 79(1) with a notice of retraction of that notice if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the circumstance described in paragraph 79(2)(a), the requirements set out in subparagraphs (b)(i) and (ii) have been met and one year has elapsed since the notice was sent by the Minister; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the circumstance described in any of paragraphs 79(2)(b) and (c) and (4)(a) to (d), the pharmacist or the practitioner named in the notice has

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: requested in writing that a retraction of the notice be sent, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: provided a letter from the provincial professional licensing authority of the province in which the pharmacist or practitioner is registered and entitled to practise in which the authority consents to the retraction of the notice.

Section.MarginalNote: Communication of information by Minister to licensing authority

Subsection.Text: The Minister must provide in writing any factual information about a pharmacist, practitioner or nurse that has been obtained under the Act or these Regulations to the provincial professional licensing authority that is responsible for the registration and authorization of the person to practise their profession

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the province in which the person is or was registered and entitled to practise if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the authority submits a written request that sets out the name and address of the person, a description of the information being requested and a statement that the information is required for the purpose of assisting a lawful investigation by the authority, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the person has

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: contravened a rule of conduct established by the authority,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: been convicted of a designated substance offence, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in a province in which the person is not registered and entitled to practise, if the authority submits to the Minister

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a written request that sets out the person’s name and address and a description of the information being requested, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a document that shows that

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the person has applied to that authority to practise in that province, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the authority has reasonable grounds to believe that the person is practising in that province without being authorized to do so.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection (1), nurse does not include a nurse practitioner.

Heading.TitleText: Notification of Application for Order of Restoration

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection 24(1) of the Act, notification of an application for an order of restoration must be given in writing to the Attorney General by registered mail and must be mailed not less than 15 days before the date on which the application is to be made to a justice.
The notification must specify

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the justice to whom the application is to be made;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the time and place at which the application is to be heard;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: details concerning the targeted substance or other thing in respect of which the application is to be made; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the evidence on which the applicant intends to rely to establish that they are entitled to possession of the targeted substance or other thing referred to in paragraph (c).

Subsection.Text: If a targeted substance is to be shipped from a country of export to a foreign country by a route that requires it to be in transit through Canada or to be transhipped in Canada, the exporter in the country of export or their agent or mandatary in Canada must obtain a permit for the transit or transhipment of the targeted substance by submitting to the Minister an application that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, municipal address and telephone number of the exporter in the country of export;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, municipal address and telephone number of the person who will be responsible for the targeted substance while it is in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the targeted substance,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its specified name and, if applicable, its brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a salt, the name of the salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its quantity, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a raw material, its purity and its anhydrous content;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the expected date of transit or transhipment in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the customs office where the importation or exportation is anticipated;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: each proposed mode of transportation in Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a transhipment, the municipal address of every place in Canada at which the targeted substance will be stored during the transhipment and the expected duration of the storage at each place.

Subsection.Text: The application must be accompanied by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the export permit issued by the competent authority in the country of export; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the import permit issued by the competent authority in the country of final destination.

Subsection.Text: The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by a person who is authorized for that purpose by the exporter, including an agent or mandatary in Canada of that exporter; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include an attestation by that person that all of the information submitted in support of the application is correct and complete to the best of their knowledge.

Subsection.Text: The applicant must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.

Subject to subsection (2), on completion of the review of the application for a permit for transit or transhipment, the Minister must issue to the applicant a permit for transit or transhipment that contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, municipal address and telephone number of the exporter in the country of export;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, municipal address and telephone number of the person who is responsible for the targeted substance while it is in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the specified name of the targeted substance, its quantity, its purity and, if applicable, its strength per unit, the number of units per package and the number of packages;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the countries of export and final destination and the numbers and expiry dates of the export and import permits issued by the competent authority in each of those countries;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the expected date of the transit or transhipment in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the customs office where the importation or exportation is anticipated;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: each proposed mode of transportation in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a transhipment, the municipal address of every place in Canada at which the targeted substance will be stored during the transhipment and the expected duration of the storage at each place; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the dates of issuance and expiry of the permit.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to issue a permit for transit or transhipment if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the issuance of the permit

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: would contravene an international obligation,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: would contravene the Act, the regulations or another Act of Parliament or a law of the country of export, of the country of final destination or of a country of transit or transhipment, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: would likely create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of the targeted substance being diverted to an illicit market or use; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the import permit issued by the competent authority in the country of final destination has expired or has been suspended or revoked.
